intro: Thesium helodes, commonly known as the golden burr, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spiny fruiting structures that contain seeds. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, often overlooked despite their ecological importance. Thesium helodes plays a role in supporting local insect populations and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
